sites.name: Špilberk Castle
sites.description: Historic fortress and former prison, now a museum complex offering panoramic views over Brno. The castle has served as a royal castle, baroque fortress, and prison throughout its 800-year history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Beautiful views year-round; castle grounds accessible in winter. Summer concerts and events.
sites.booking_tips: Buy tickets online for skip-the-line access. Combined tickets available for multiple exhibitions.

sites.name: Villa Tugendhat
sites.description: UNESCO World Heritage modernist villa designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe. An architectural masterpiece of functionalist design from 1930, showcasing revolutionary interior design concepts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Indoor attraction, perfect for any weather. Garden tours available in warmer months.
sites.booking_tips: Advance booking essential - limited daily visitors. Book weeks ahead, especially for weekend visits.

sites.name: Cathedral of St. Peter and Paul
sites.description: Iconic twin-spired Gothic cathedral dominating Brno's skyline from Petrov Hill. The cathedral features beautiful neo-Gothic architecture and offers stunning city views from its towers.
sites.seasonal_notes: Accessible year-round; tower climbs offer spectacular views. Christmas masses are particularly atmospheric.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry to cathedral; small fee for tower access. Check service times before visiting.

sites.name: Zelný trh (Cabbage Market)
sites.description: Historic market square in the heart of Brno, home to the unique Parnas Fountain and surrounded by beautiful baroque and renaissance buildings. Daily fresh produce market since medieval times.
sites.seasonal_notes: Year-round market; Christmas markets in December. Best atmosphere in morning when market is most active.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early morning for freshest produce and liveliest atmosphere.

sites.name: Moravian Museum
sites.description: Largest museum in Moravia featuring extensive collections of natural history, archaeology, and ethnography. Houses the famous Venus of Dolní Věstonice, the oldest known ceramic sculpture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Indoor attraction perfect for rainy days. Special exhibitions change seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: Regular tickets available at entrance. Student discounts available. Check for special exhibition pricing.

sites.name: Technical Museum
sites.description: Fascinating museum showcasing Czech industrial heritage with vintage cars, motorcycles, aircraft, and machinery. Interactive exhibits make it perfect for families and technology enthusiasts.
sites.seasonal_notes: Great indoor activity for any weather. Special events and demonstrations on weekends.
sites.booking_tips: Family tickets available. Check website for special events and guided tours in English.

neighborhoods.name: Centrum (City Center)
neighborhoods.description: Historic city center of Brno with Špilberk Castle, Cathedral of St. Peter and Paul, and main shopping areas around Zelný trh market square.
key_attractions: Cathedral of St. Peter and Paul
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Mix of traditional Czech restaurants, international cuisine, and trendy cafes

neighborhoods.name: Veveří
neighborhoods.description: Vibrant student quarter home to Masaryk University, with leafy streets, parks, and a thriving cultural scene.
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Student-friendly restaurants, trendy cafes, and international food

neighborhoods.name: Žabovřesky
neighborhoods.description: Upscale residential area known for Villa Tugendhat and beautiful villas, offering quiet streets with architectural gems.

neighborhoods.name: Královo Pole
neighborhoods.description: Modern district with technical university, shopping centers, and mix of residential and commercial areas.
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Chain restaurants, shopping mall food courts, modern cafes

neighborhoods.name: Líšeň
neighborhoods.description: Residential area with parks and recreational facilities, popular with families and offering good value accommodation.
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Local Czech restaurants and family-friendly establishments

neighborhoods.name: Černá Pole
neighborhoods.description: Mixed residential and commercial area with good transport connections, home to many locals and students.
neighborhoods.dining_scene: Local pubs, traditional Czech restaurants, student eateries

restaurants.name: Borgo Agnese
restaurants.description: Brno's premier fine dining restaurant offering creative cuisine with local Moravian ingredients and excellent wine selection from South Moravian vineyards.

restaurants.name: Restaurant Pavillon
restaurants.description: Historic restaurant in Lužánky Park serving traditional Moravian cuisine in a beautiful Art Nouveau pavilion setting.

restaurants.name: Koishi
restaurants.description: High-quality Japanese restaurant offering authentic sushi and traditional dishes, popular with Brno's international community.

restaurants.name: Lokál U Caipla
restaurants.description: Popular beer hall chain location serving hearty Czech classics with excellent fresh Pilsner Urquell and lively atmosphere.

restaurants.name: Pivnice Pegas
restaurants.description: Brno's oldest brewery restaurant brewing their own beer since 1999, serving traditional Czech food with house-brewed specialties.

cafes.name: Café Era
cafes.description: Stylish café in the city center known for excellent coffee, homemade desserts, and cozy atmosphere perfect for working or relaxing.

cafes.name: Coffee Source
cafes.description: Third-wave coffee roastery and café focusing on single-origin beans and alternative brewing methods.

cafes.name: Café Momenta
cafes.description: Atmospheric café popular with students and locals, offering good coffee, light meals, and cultural events.

local_specialties.description: Traditional Moravian pork dish with sauerkraut and bread dumplings, often considered the regional signature dish.
Czech national dish of marinated beef sirloin with cream sauce, bread dumplings, and cranberry sauce - expertly prepared in Brno.
Strong-smelling soft cheese from nearby Olomouc, often served with onions and bread - a beloved Moravian delicacy.
Traditional sweet pastries filled with poppy seeds, cheese, or fruit, especially popular during festivals and holidays.
Moravian region is famous for game dishes including venison, wild boar, and duck, often served with traditional accompaniments.

drinks.name: Moravian Wine
drinks.description: Brno is gateway to South Moravian wine region. Try local white wines like Grüner Veltliner and Riesling, or reds like Svatovavřinecké.

drinks.name: Bernard Beer
drinks.description: Family brewery from nearby Humpolec producing excellent unfiltered lagers and seasonal specialties, widely available in Brno.

drinks.name: Moravian Slivovice
drinks.description: Traditional plum brandy from Moravian region, stronger and more refined than standard versions, perfect as digestif.

drinks.name: Czech Beer
drinks.description: Excellent selection of Czech beers including Pilsner Urquell, Budvar, and local Starobrno brewery products.

destinations.whyGo: Czech capital with stunning medieval architecture, historic castle complex, and vibrant cultural scene.
Imperial capital with magnificent palaces, world-class museums, and coffee culture. Very close to Brno.
Charming Slovak capital on the Danube with compact old town and castle overlooking the river.
Magnificent Hungarian capital split by the Danube, famous for thermal baths and stunning architecture.
Historic Moravian city with UNESCO-listed Holy Trinity Column and beautiful old town.
Industrial city transformed into cultural hub, known for unique post-industrial architecture and mining heritage.
Medieval fairy-tale town with stunning castle and UNESCO World Heritage old town.

spring.description: Traditional Easter markets in Zelný trh (Cabbage Market) with local Moravian crafts, painted eggs, and seasonal treats.
Beautiful spring flowers and cherry blossoms in Central Europe's oldest public park, perfect for leisurely walks.
International design festival showcasing contemporary design, architecture, and urban planning with exhibitions throughout the city.

summer.description: Outdoor Shakespeare performances in English and Czech in the romantic setting of Špilberk Castle grounds.
Celebrate the nearby South Moravian wine region with wine tastings, festivals, and vineyard visits just outside Brno.
International fireworks competition with spectacular displays over Brno Dam, drawing visitors from across Europe.
Private gardens and courtyards open to public, showcasing Brno's hidden green spaces and garden design.

autumn.description: International music festival featuring classical, jazz, and contemporary performances in historic venues.
Join local wine harvest activities in nearby vineyards and taste fresh Moravian wines during harvest season.
Beautiful autumn foliage in Denis Gardens below Špilberk Castle with stunning views over the city.

winter.description: Atmospheric Christmas markets in Zelný trh and Freedom Square with traditional Moravian crafts, mulled wine, and holiday treats.
Festive New Year's Eve celebrations with fireworks over Špilberk Castle and outdoor festivities in the city center.
Special winter exhibitions and guided tours of the famous modernist UNESCO site, offering unique perspectives on functionalist architecture.

ranges.notes: Major holiday - many attractions closed, cold weather (-2 to 3°C), post-celebration cleanup, limited transport
Post-holiday recovery, gradual reopening, winter sales begin, very cold (-3 to 2°C)
Coldest period (-4 to 1°C), possible snow, ideal for indoor activities, very low tourism
Winter continues, cold (-2 to 4°C), fewer crowds, excellent museum time
Gradual warming (0 to 6°C), winter sales ending, university town coming alive

schoolHolidays.description: Czech school holidays - increased family tourism

ranges.notes: Spring hints, gradually warming (2 to 8°C), days noticeably longer
considerations: Early signs of spring in parks
Good time for planning wine region visits

ranges.notes: Early spring transition, variable weather (2 to 10°C), increasing daylight
Spring awakening, pleasant temperatures (5 to 12°C), perfect for walking
Spring officially arrives, excellent conditions (7 to 15°C), Easter market preparations

springLocations.luzankyPark: First spring flowers, Central Europe's oldest park

considerations: Wine region day trips become feasible

ranges.notes: Beautiful spring weather (8 to 16°C), cherry blossoms and spring flowers
ranges.culturalTradition: Spring blooms in Lužánky Park and Denis Gardens

ranges.notes: Easter celebrations, spring markets, ideal weather (10 to 18°C), perfect for sightseeing

easterActivities.zelnyTrh: Traditional Easter markets with Moravian crafts
easterActivities.traditionalCrafts: Painted eggs and folk art demonstrations

ranges.notes: Perfect spring conditions (12 to 20°C), comfortable temperatures, ideal sightseeing

specialConsiderations.easter: Major Christian holiday affects opening hours and creates family tourism spike
specialConsiderations.springBreaks: University students and families increase tourism
specialConsiderations.weather: Most stable spring weather, excellent for outdoor activities

ranges.notes: Many closures but special events, beautiful spring weather
International design festival, perfect weather (13-21°C), cultural events
Historical commemorations, some closures, spring flowers peak
Excellent weather, not peak tourism yet, perfect for all activities (15-23°C)
Excellent weather (16-25°C), long daylight, pre-peak season
International fireworks competition at Brno Dam, perfect weather
Outdoor Shakespeare at Špilberk, Festival of Open Gardens, summer begins
Peak tourism season, hot weather (18-27°C), crowded attractions
Continued heat, many locals on vacation, student population reduced
Hot weather (17-27°C), many locals on vacation, reduced university population
Students returning, weather still warm, crowds decreasing
Excellent post-peak season, warm weather continues (14-22°C), wine harvest begins
Perfect temperatures, cultural events, wine harvest tours, autumn colors
Beautiful fall colors, comfortable temperatures (8-16°C), wine harvest continues
Peak autumn colors, golden light for photography, comfortable walking weather
Fall colors continue, cooling temperatures (4-10°C), fewer crowds
National holiday commemorations, some closures, historical significance
Festive atmosphere begins, cooler weather, holiday preparations
Festive atmosphere, Christmas markets at Zelný trh and Freedom Square, mulled wine, Moravian crafts
Many closures but special atmosphere, family celebrations, quiet streets
Between Christmas and New Year's - moderate tourist activity, sales begin
Fireworks over Špilberk Castle, special events, festive celebrations

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very high crowds, limited value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value

valuePricing.strategy: Book 1-2 months ahead for best rates

accommodation.studentAreas: Veveří neighborhood offers budget options near university

localTraditions.lunch: Main meal, many restaurants offer lunch menus

monthlyHighlights.january: Winter atmosphere, cozy museums, Villa Tugendhat tours, low crowds
monthlyHighlights.february: Authentic local experience, excellent museum conditions, budget-friendly
monthlyHighlights.march: Spring awakening, comfortable temperatures, university life returns
monthlyHighlights.april: Perfect spring weather, Easter markets, ideal for walking tours
monthlyHighlights.may: Brno Design Days, excellent conditions, wine region accessible
monthlyHighlights.june: Ignis Brunensis fireworks, Shakespeare Festival, peak weather
monthlyHighlights.july: Peak summer, outdoor dining, high tourism
monthlyHighlights.august: Warm weather, student life resuming, manageable crowds
monthlyHighlights.september: Wine harvest season, Moravian Autumn Festival, perfect conditions
monthlyHighlights.october: Autumn colors, comfortable temperatures, wine harvest continues
monthlyHighlights.november: Cozy atmosphere, cultural events, fewer crowds
monthlyHighlights.december: Christmas markets, festive atmosphere, New Year's celebrations

weatherNotes.spring: Variable weather, layers recommended, beautiful blooms
weatherNotes.summer: Warm to hot, occasional thunderstorms, excellent for outdoor activities
weatherNotes.autumn: Comfortable temperatures, beautiful colors, wine harvest season
weatherNotes.winter: Cold but manageable, occasional snow, perfect for indoor attractions

transportation.publicTransport: Excellent tram and bus system, student-friendly
transportation.walking: Very walkable city center, comfortable distances
transportation.cycling: Good infrastructure, wine region cycling routes
transportation.regional: Easy access to Vienna (1.5h), Prague (2.5h), wine region (30min)

uniqueFeatures.wineRegion: Gateway to South Moravian wine country
uniqueFeatures.universities: Major university city with vibrant student life
uniqueFeatures.architecture: Mix of historical and modernist (Villa Tugendhat)
uniqueFeatures.festivals: Strong cultural calendar throughout the year
